channel.title: Dancing – Vamos a Bailar
channel.description: A traveling blog for discovering South America

item.title: Bogota and the salt cathedral
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
The salt cathedral This impressive building is located 47 kms from Bogota in another town called Zipaquira. It has been built inside a salt mine currently still under activity. Thus, the cathedral is below 180 meters of earth. An incredible lighting effect made the rooms very beautiful. In the colossus Colombian capital A really big […]

The post Bogota and the salt cathedral appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: My crush on Sucre
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
After being sick when I arrived, I continued to suffer due to the altitude. Sucre is located at 2,700 meters high. At the beginning, I got a headache and difficulties to eat. Only after three weeks of being at this altitude or higher, I could be normal again. Aside from this trouble, I was able […]

The post My crush on Sucre appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Montevideo carnival
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
The carnival in Uruguay The event The carnival in Uruguay is the longest one in the world, lasting in total for 40 days. The 3 main events are the opening on the first day, the parades in the middle and the final performance weekend. However, during all that 40 days, you can enjoy shows in […]

The post Montevideo carnival appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: One month of tango in Buenos Aires
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
I arrived in Buenos Aires with only knowing two things: the name Tango and that it was famous in Buenos Aires. As a dance passionate, I made a deal with myself. I will try one class and if I like it, I will learn tango for one month. And as you can guess I fell […]

The post One month of tango in Buenos Aires appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Discover the city of Buenos Aires
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Welcome in Buenos Aires, capital and main city of Argentina. While visiting the city can be done in 3 to 5 days, learning tango took more time. I stayed one month for practicing tango, I wish I could have stayed more. Here I present how to enjoy the city while staying there. 1. Walk in […]

The post Discover the city of Buenos Aires appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.
